[B]2 of 6[/B]

Amateur horror film competition. Short horror films are judged by a cinema audience, who score each film on its scariness alone. The auditorium is rigged with night vision cameras.

[img]http://extraimago.com/images/2015/10/27/24a4209bb28890d87fff49a8b37b6eca.jpg[/img]

Series searching for the scariest amateur horror film in the UK in a competition which brings the phenomenon of homemade horror into the living room to unearth the next big horror director.
Short horror films are judged by a cinema audience, who score each film on its scariness alone. The cinema auditorium is rigged with night vision cameras to capture each and every terrified reaction.
The audience's top three highest-scoring films from across the series will be shown to world-renowned director Eduardo Sanchez (The Blair Witch Project) who will pick one as a winner. That lucky film-maker will walk away with Â£20,000 worth of support and funding towards their next project.
Host Matthew Giffen controls the show from the projection room, guiding us through the competition with wit, charm and a small dose of creepiness
